awd_abstract_narration: 9311974   Brown       Ohio State University requests support from NSF for the  connection of Hocking College to the Ohio Academic Resources  Network (OARnet) which is the NSF mid-level network that serves  the State of Ohio.  A primary goal of OARnet is to facilitate  collaborative projects and sharing of resources between  institutions, including those outside the state.       OARnet will provide operations management and information  services and it will give the six universities a 56 thousand bit  per second connection to the NSFNET, a high speed (1.5 - 45  million bits per second) National Backbone network.       The universities need greater functionality and network  speed to be able to access supercomputers, libraries, and make  file transfers along with being able to implement a more reliable  mail system. Students and faculty research will benefit from the  link.  This is also a unique opportunity for the schools to  explore innovative educational resources.  ***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
